citation.article-title: Lactobacillus senmaizukei sp. nov., isolated from Japanese pickle.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus senmaizukei sp. nov.

Lactobacillus senmaizukei (sen.mai.zu′ke.i. N.L. n. senmaizukeum senmaizuke, a traditional fermented pickle; N.L. gen. n. senmaizukei of senmaizuke, referring to the isolation of the type strain from a traditional fermented pickle produced in Kyoto, Japan).
Cells are Gram-positive, catalase-negative, non-motile, non-spore-forming rods (0.5–0.8×1.0–5.0 μm).
Colonies on GYP agar are circular, low-convex with entire margins and non-pigmented (1.0–2.0 mm in diameter after 2 days of growth).
Can grow in up to 8.0 % NaCl and at 15 °C, but not at 45 °C.
The specific growth rate in 5.0 % NaCl is 50 % (100 % growth without NaCl).
Produces dl-lactic acid heterofermentatively from glucose.
Acetic acid and ethanol are also produced as other metabolites (HPLC analysis).

Acid is produced from aesculin, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-gluconate, 2-keto-d-gluconate, N-acetylglucosamine, d-ribose and d-xylose, but not from adonitol, d-amygdalin, arabinose, arabitol, arbutin, dulcitol, erythritol, cellobiose, gentiobiose, 5-keto-d-gluconate, methyl α-d-glucoside, glycogen, glycerol, inositol, inulin, lactose, d-lyxose, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, methyl α-d-mannoside, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, salicin, sorbitol, l-sorbose, starch, sucrose, d-tagatose, trehalose, turanose, xylitol, l-xylose or methyl β-xyloside.
Ammonia is not produced from arginine.
Peptidoglycan structure is of the A4α l-Lys–d-Asp type.
The type strain, L13T (=NBRC 103853T=TISTR 1847T), was isolated from senmaizuke, one of the traditional pickles from Kyoto, Japan.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 46 mol%.
